title: On "Consistent Quantization of Nearly Singular Superconducting Circuits"
authors: I. L. Egusquiza and A. Parra-Rodriguez
abstract:
The analysis conducted by Rymarz and DiVincenzo (Phys. Rev. X 13, 021017
(2023)) regarding quantization of superconducting circuits is insufficient to
justify their general conclusions, most importantly the need to discard
Kirchhoff's laws to effect variable reductions. Amongst a variety of reasons,
one source of several disagreements with experimental and theoretical results
is the long-standing dispute between extended vs compact variables in the
presence of Josephson junctions.
